items.content_html: In theory I understand those who protest their words getting sucked into the LLM maw. In reality (emotionally and practically), I have no sympathy for the essentially-copyright-maximalist argument. If you don’t want your work reused by minute individuals or behemoths alike, don’t put it in the open.

items.title: L.E.A.D. 2.5 Word Processor
items.content_html:
<img src=“uploads/2023/img-0143.jpeg” width=“600” height=“446” alt=“A wall art piece titled “The L.E.A.D*. 2.5 Word Processor”>

  • Light, Economical, and Dependable.

displaying a yellow wooden pencil that boasts the same phrase.

Featuring

  • Fine or large print (manual control)

  • Letters, words, or phrases can be deleted with a flick of the wrist

  • Polished wooden cabinet

  • Unlimited memory capacity depending on the aptitude of the user

Note: model shown comes equipped with “Cylindrical Malfunction Adjuster.”

Then there are four other models:

One for those who mak no mistakes (a pencil sharpened on both ends)

One for those who make only mistakes (a pencil with an eraser on both ends)

One for those who do very little (a golf-pencil sized pencil)

And one for those who do absolutely nothing (a pencil with no erase, unsharpened on both ends)” class=“wp-image-1732” width=“960” height=“714”/>

A flea market find. When I told the vendor I kinda-sorta collect pencils, he was mystified. I showed him the pencils I happened to have in my case…and ended up trading him for a motley assortment of eight pencils (a couple of Blackwings, a couple of Tombows, and four Musgraves) and a well-used Sonic Rachetta sharpener. A great deal for me, and I may have brought someone into the pencil fold.

Apologies for the shadows. It’s hard to get a photo through the glass!
